page.title: 13GEOS IN EDAY
page.content: Geos is an Orkney word describing a place on the coastline where the sea has smashed a narrow gorge in the rocks and the sea comes right up into it. Geos are used by the local people for taking dinghies or small boats up onto the land. In gales the sea lashes up onto the rocks and leaves driftwood. This is very useful for people who have open fires in their houses. Geos are mostly found in areas of hard blue rock. There is an old story that there is an underground passageway running from the geo at Sealskerry to the house of Carpaquoy but this cannot be proven because the sea goes right into the geo at high tide.
